tool.name: xcms plot raw
tool.description: Plot raw data filtered by m/z range and retention time (RT) range

configfiles.configfile: library(xcms) library(MsExperiment) library(Spectra) mse = readMsExperiment(file.path('${input}')) mz_offset = ${tolerance_ppm} * 1e-6 * ${mz_value} rt_offset = ${rt_range} / 2 raw = mse |> filterRt(rt = ${rt} + c(-rt_offset, rt_offset)) |> filterMzRange(mz = ${mz_value} + c(-mz_offset, mz_offset)) png(filename = '${output_filename}') par(oma = c(0.5, 2, 0.5, 1)) plot(raw) dev.off()

param.name: rt_range
param.label: Retention Time Range
param.help: Retention time range for the plot

data.name: output_filename
data.label: PLot at m/z=$mz_value and rt=$rt of $input.element_identifier

tool.help: This tool plots the raw data filtered by m/z range and retention time (RT) range from an mzML file. It uses a default tolerance of 10 ppm and retention time range of 5 s. More information and detailed instructions can be found in the tutorial at: https://jorainer.github.io/xcmsTutorials/articles/xcms-preprocessing.html#data-visualization
